item.description:
Every month the Wadsworth Atheneum schedules a movie to end its First Thursday evening.  In February it will be the new James Bond movie, "Skyfall." 

Summary:  Bond's loyalty to M is tested as her past comes back to haunt her. Both deal with the unknown as MI6 comes under attack.


Cast: Daniel Craig, Judi Dench, Javier Bardem, Ralph Fiennes, Naomie Harris

Director: Sam Mendes

143 minutes

www.skyfall-movie.com/site

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1074638

 

I set the start time at the time I am likely to head for the Aetna Theatre lobby.  Feel free to come earlier to enjoy First Thursday!  It starts at 5:00pm, costs just $5 (including the film) and is free to members and students with current ID - or in February, to anybody wearing RED!  For February, the event will feature the opening of Deb Sokolow / MATRIX 166 complete with a tour by the artist; world music by Mikata, nationally renowned Hartford cartoonist Joe Young showing you how to create your own cartoon, fashions from Stackpole’s & Tuesday’s, and Chef Wheeler Del Toro will offer a cooking demo and tasting (seating limited.  You can also sample beer with a free tasting by the Olde Burnside Brewing Company (pity they didn't use them in the film!).  The Museum Café will be open for dinner; reservations are recommended because of the crowds.
item.how_to_find_us: I am a short brunette with glasses, I will be wearing a dark red dress (remember: wear RED and get in free!) and a cream-colored scarf with stylized flowers in red, green, and brown. I'll also have my usual black purse with green trim.
item.name: "Skyfall" @ First Thursday
